body_html: That would require allocation for every empty tensor, which we don't want. The original code is buggy. You shouldn't be calling anything on undefined tensors except .defined(). The question is simply do you want to mitigate the bad behavior, and can we do it without impacting performance.
body_text: That would require allocation for every empty tensor, which we don't want. The original code is buggy. You shouldn't be calling anything on undefined tensors except .defined(). The question is simply do you want to mitigate the bad behavior, and can we do it without impacting performance.
body: That would require allocation for every empty tensor, which we don't want. The original code is buggy. You shouldn't be calling anything on undefined tensors except `.defined()`. The question is simply do you want to mitigate the bad behavior, and can we do it without impacting performance.
